title: Github's Open Source CoC Guide
description: A high-level overview about the process for projects looking to adopt and enforce a CoC.

title: Contributor Covenant
description: This is a solidly developed and popular CoC that includes guides and tools for adding it to your project. It's now used as the [Linux Kernel's CoC](https://www.kernel.org/doc/html/latest/process/code-of-conduct.html) among many other projects.

title: Geek Feminism List of Resources
description: The Geek Feminism community has a lot of information about making diverse communities feel comfortable, as well as a wide array of articles about CoCs, both for communities and events.

title: Ashe Dryden FAQ on CoCs
description: Ashe is a diversity and inclusion consultant, and has a detailed FAQ and lists of other useful resources.

title: Code of Conduct in Open Source Projects (Paper)
description: This 2017 scholarly article researched the CoCs used by a variety of open source projects, along with analyzing which core CoCs were used where.

title: CoC Research Spreadsheet
description: Research project reviewing project CoCs and issues reported.

title: CoC Conductor tool
description: GitHub tool that auto-detects common kinds of CoCs in project repos.

title: Ada Initiative
description: A (now closed) non-profit that accelerated many of the discussions around CoCs in open source and other online spaces.

title: Have Additions To This List?
description: This website is an open source project - so submit your pull requests for consideration!
